articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Trump's Rapid Reshaping: From Foreign Aid Freeze to WHO Re-engagement
articles.description: President Trump has ordered a review of US foreign aid, leading to a suspension of assistance programs. The CIA now suggests COVID-19 likely emerged from a lab, and Trump hints at rejoining the WHO. Meanwhile, flights carrying Afghan special visa holders are halted, and challenges in deporting migrants persist.
articles.content: President Donald Trump's administration has issued a 'stop-work' order suspending U.S. foreign aid, pending a review on its alignment with his foreign policy. Military financing waivers were approved only for Israel and Egypt, according to a State De... [590 chars]

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Trump's Sweeping Changes Stir Controversy and Criticism
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump's recent actions, including firing watchdogs and halting diversity initiatives, have sparked significant controversy and criticism. His latest moves encompass changes to taxation in Las Vegas and immigration policy, while also impacting international aid and causing unrest among TikTok users.
articles.content: President Donald Trump's termination of various inspectors general at government agencies has drawn sharp criticism across political lines. This mass dismissal, described by many as a 'purge', allows Trump to appoint his own loyalists to these pivota... [648 chars]

articles.author: Yahoo Canada Finance
articles.title: Trump leans into his pledge to eliminate taxes on tips at a Las Vegas rally
articles.description: LAS VEGAS (AP) — President Donald Trump came to Las Vegas on Saturday to crow about his campaign promise to eliminate taxes on tips, signaling to allies in Congress the importance of the policy but stopping well short of offering details for making the slogan a reality.

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Trump Lifts Biden's Block on Bombs to Israel Amid Gaza Tensions
articles.description: President Donald Trump instructed the U.S. military to lift a hold on bomb supplies to Israel, previously imposed by former President Joe Biden. The hold was due to concerns over impacts on Gaza civilians amidst Israel's conflict with Palestinian militants. Trump's move aligns with ongoing U.S.-Israel relations.
articles.content: President Donald Trump has directed the U.S. military to release a hold implemented by former President Joe Biden on delivering 2,000-pound bombs to Israel, according to a White House source. This move had been widely anticipated as Biden's hold was ... [635 chars]

articles.title: Senate Confirms Noem for Homeland Security
articles.description: South Dakota Gov. Kristi Noem won Senate confirmation Saturday as secretary of the Department of Homeland Security, an agency central to President Trump's immigration policies....

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Oracle's Bid to Steer TikTok Amid National Security Concerns
articles.description: The Trump administration plans a deal where Oracle and outside investors take control of TikTok's global operations, with ByteDance retaining a minority stake. The move aims to address national security concerns over data misuse. However, the terms are still under negotiation.
articles.content:
The Trump administration is formulating a plan to save TikTok by transferring control of the app's global operations to Oracle and a consortium of outside investors, according to National Public Radio's report on Saturday.
The proposal, currently bei... [705 chars]

articles.title: Trump's ICE raids for criminal migrants expands into LA
articles.description: The Trump administration’s mass-deportation offensive expanded into Los Angeles Saturday with pre-dawn roundups, part of a West Coast operation expected to run seven days a week, sources told The Post.
